body:
In the card explorer/deck editor if a double sided card is displayed there is currently no way to easily identify what the reverse side is. And even if you know what the transformed side is you still need to go searching in the card pool to find it.

Add an option so that if a double-sided card is selected there is way to automatically select the other side in the card pool which will also update the image in the Card Viewer.

The same applies to flip cards to a lesser degree because both states are displayed on the same side.
author: [lodici123](https://code.google.com/u/lodici123/)
title: Add option to transform card in card explorer.

comments.body:
Published https://bitbucket.org/lodici/magarena/commits/0377ecd3c54691e2ceba74d7d15985f6afecff03 .

Clicking on a double-faced card in CardViewer will show reverse side. This simply displays the other side's image - which might be enough. It does not sync the card-pool which is made trickier because you might have a filtered card pool in which one side of the card is not included. However, even being able to switch the image is an improvement.

content:
_From [lodici123](https://code.google.com/u/lodici123/) on August 17, 2014 13:54:58_

In the card explorer/deck editor if a double sided card is displayed there is currently no way to easily identify what the reverse side is. And even if you know what the transformed side is you still need to go searching in the card pool to find it.

Add an option so that if a double-sided card is selected there is way to automatically select the other side in the card pool which will also update the image in the Card Viewer.

The same applies to flip cards to a lesser degree because both states are displayed on the same side.
